edu.cmu.al.experiment

Interface ExperimentResultInterface


  • public interface ExperimentResultInterface
    This interface is used to generate the experiment result. Such as the accuracy, recall, P@N precision. Also, in order to test whether the low precision problem is due to training model or feature engineering, it will label all the instances to check this problem.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float computePAtK(java.util.List<Instance> pred, java.util.List<Instance> real, int k)
      Compute the P@K precision of the predicted result.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccuracy

        float getAccuracy(java.util.List<Instance> pred,
                java.util.List<Instance> real)
        Compute the accuracy of the predicted result. It will compare the predicted result with the real document label. The accuracy is the number of true positive documents plus the number of true negative documents divided by all documents that predicted.
        Parameters:
        pred - the predicted result
        real - the real result
        Returns:
        accuracy

      • getRecall

        float getRecall(java.util.List<Instance> pred,
              java.util.List<Instance> real)
        Compute the recall of the predicted result. It will compare the predicted result with the real document label. The recall is the number of true positive documents divided by all positive documents that predicted
        Parameters:
        pred - the predicted result
        real - the real result
        Returns:
        recall

      • computePAtK

        float computePAtK(java.util.List<Instance> pred,
                java.util.List<Instance> real,
                int k)
        Compute the P@K precision of the predicted result. It will compare the predicted result with the real document label. The P@K is defined as the precision of first K predicted document.
        Parameters:
        pred - the predicted result
        real - the real result
        k - first k document
        Returns:
        precision

      • labelAllInstance

        java.util.List<Instance> labelAllInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list)
        Label all the instances. In this function, it will get the real labels of the instances from the database and then assign the real labels for the given instances.
        Parameters:
        list - the instances to be labeled
        Returns:
